channel.title: Lunch with Lyle
channel.description: Inspired by fun-a-day, this daily podcast is a long form discussion around the human condition esp. around how we thrive as humans while engaging with technology. Join Lyle Troxell and his guests.
channel.copyright: 2022 Creative Commons, Share and Share Alike
channel.itunes:summary: Inspired by fun-a-day, this daily podcast is a long form discussion around the human condition esp. around how we thrive as humans while engaging with technology. Join Lyle Troxell and his guests.
channel.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell
channel.itunes:keywords: family, community, connection, music, social media

item.title: Vast Beautiful Experience
item.description: Maggi Hoogs joins me to speak about Neurodiversity, Celiac Disease, and the lessons we learned from this fun-a-day podcast for the month of January 2022.
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Lyle Troxell, Maggi Hoogs)
item.itunes:title: Vast Beautiful Experience
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell, Maggi Hoogs
item.itunes:summary: Maggi Hoogs joins me to speak about Neurodiversity, Celiac Disease, and the lessons we learned from this fun-a-day podcast for the month of January 2022.
item.itunes:subtitle: Maggi Hoogs joins me to speak about Neurodiversity, Celiac Disease, and the lessons we learned from this fun-a-day podcast for the month of January 2022.

item.title: Looking Closely
item.description: Jennifer Gonzalez joins me for a discussion on looking at and researching Art, being an academic, getting comfortable with terms Latinx/Chicanx , specialization in the Humanities, Complexity and Civil Discourse, Profit and Art, Art vs Making, and what we decide to do and not do.
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Lyle Troxell)
item.itunes:title: Looking Closely
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell
item.itunes:summary: Jennifer Gonzalez joins me for a discussion on looking at and researching Art, being an academic, getting comfortable with terms Latinx/Chicanx , specialization in the Humanities, Complexity and Civil Discourse, Profit and Art, Art vs Making, and what we decide to do and not do.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jennifer Gonzalez joins me for a discussion on looking at and researching Art, being an academic, getting comfortable with terms Latinx/Chicanx , specialization in the Humanities, Complexity and Civil Discourse, Profit and Art, Art vs Making, and what we decide to do and not do.

item.title: Labor Land - something was wrong
item.description: After the birth of her son Raven Lang knew something was wrong with the medical structure around birth. Learning the right way to support a mother giving birth was a process of witnessing births and re-learning. From her and other women's experiences Raven helped spear head the Home Birth Midwifery movement.
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Lyle Troxell)
item.itunes:title: Labor Land - something was wrong
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell
item.itunes:summary: After the birth of her son Raven Lang knew something was wrong with the medical structure around birth. Learning the right way to support a mother giving birth was a process of witnessing births and re-learning. From her and other women's experiences Raven helped spear head the Home Birth Midwifery movement.
item.itunes:subtitle: After the birth of her son Raven Lang knew something was wrong with the medical structure around birth. Learning the right way to support a mother giving birth was a process of witnessing births and re-learning. From her and other women's experiences Raven helped spear head the Home Birth Midwifery movement.

item.title: Other Currency
item.description: • Article from the Wall Street Journal on the turn-around of the Cabrillo Festival.
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Lyle Troxell)
item.content:encoded: • Article from the Wall Street Journal on the turn-around of the Cabrillo Festival.
item.itunes:title: Other Currency
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell
item.itunes:summary: Tom Fredricks speaks of retirement and his very full career as a ballet dancer in New York and Switzerland, marketing and tour director for the Houston Ballet for ten years, and co-running the Santa Cruz based Cabrillo Festival of Contemporary Music for over 20 years including it's transformation from a bankrupt organization into the world renowned festival it is now. Tom studies undergraduate work at Notre Dame, and holds an MBA from Stanford Business School.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tom Fredricks speaks of retirement and his very full career as a ballet dancer in New York and Switzerland, marketing and tour director for the Houston Ballet for ten years, and co-running the Santa Cruz based Cabrillo Festival of Contemporary Music for over 20 years including it's transformation from a bankrupt organization into the world renowned festival it is now. Tom studies undergraduate work at Notre Dame, and holds an MBA from Stanford Business School.

item.title: In a Rock Tumbler
item.description: Bonnie Jean Primbsch is a former radio broadcaster, an artists, a gardener, a grief counselor, a conflict mediator, and does her best not to Bogart the Flow.

item.title: 30 summers and 5 billion years
item.description:
Checkout Emerson's book Murder Capital of the World.
Em and I made a podcast in 2008 about new Media - Media Sound Off.
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Lyle Troxell, Emerson Murray)
item.content:encoded:
Checkout Emerson's book Murder Capital of the World.
Em and I made a podcast in 2008 about new Media - Media Sound Off.
item.itunes:title: 30 summers and 5 billion years
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell, Emerson Murray
item.itunes:summary: Emerson Murray, is an author, painter, film maker, gamer, radio-DJ, inaction figure maker, and an inspiration. I met Emerson in Highschool, he handed me a camera and told me to take pictures. He made me a bit character in a sci-fi melodrama, he made me a lead in a small black and white film, and we spent more then a decade battling aliens and creating worlds together.
item.itunes:subtitle: Emerson Murray, is an author, painter, film maker, gamer, radio-DJ, inaction figure maker, and an inspiration. I met Emerson in Highschool, he handed me a camera and told me to take pictures. He made me a bit character in a sci-fi melodrama, he made me a lead in a small black and white film, and we spent more then a decade battling aliens and creating worlds together.
item.itunes:keywords: santa cruz, murder capital of the world, author

item.title: Learning to Learn, Empathy, Curiosity
item.description:
• DuoLingo Learn a Language with an app?
  • Luis von Ahn

Wanna hear more from Warren, check out my episodes with him on GeekSpeak.org - or checkout his book The Software Arts .

Fun quote from Warren about being an academic: "You are always in your head and your head is somewhere else."

item.title: Badass
item.description: Pearl Hoogs is an impressive young woman, she has built her own house (yurt) and lived off the grid, and she fights wild fires.... she also happens to be my niece and lives next door. I asked her to join me for "Lunch" to chat about her experiences and what she things about life. We talked all night - and maybe I will release more of the conversation at another time, but here is our second recording... where we tried to be more concise. Enjoy.
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Lyle Troxell)
item.itunes:title: Badass

item.title: Beauty in Sharing your Struggle

item.itunes:title: Beauty in Sharing your Struggle
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell, Dixita Limbachia
item.itunes:summary: "There is beauty in struggling, and sharing that struggling, and that's what helps you connect with other people" - Dixita Limbachia, a new employee at Netflix. She got to know me through the WeAreNetflix podcast, and we get to know her a bit in this episode.
item.itunes:subtitle: "There is beauty in struggling, and sharing that struggling, and that's what helps you connect with other people" - Dixita Limbachia, a new employee at Netflix. She got to know me through the WeAreNetflix podcast, and we get to know her a bit in this episode.

item.title: The Hardest Job
item.description: In 1999 Jon Compton and I played board games, built internet things for a telco, and debated. And because of this podcast Jon is back in my life right when he is going through the hardest job, the death of his father. Jon works for the DOD simulating conflict. He has a sharp mind and some wonderful ideas on why and how we can make the world better. It's really late - I'm not sure this is all making sense. So please forgive me.
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Jon Compton, Lyle Troxell)
item.itunes:title: The Hardest Job
item.itunes:author: Jon Compton, Lyle Troxell

item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell
item.itunes:summary: Michael Paulson, got Covid, streams programing on Twitch, believes in "Love God, Love People, and Love the Planet", lives in the present with his family, gives a lot of money away to charity, and has fun doing all of it.
item.itunes:subtitle: Michael Paulson, got Covid, streams programing on Twitch, believes in "Love God, Love People, and Love the Planet", lives in the present with his family, gives a lot of money away to charity, and has fun doing all of it.

item.title: Rebooting with Softness
item.description: Dr. Juko Holiday seems to fill many people's lives with joy. She runs Ease Mountain Yoga in Ben Lomond, CA, which has become a great center of community our small mountain valley. When we were thinking about impressive people with something to teach about having a full-filling life, Juko came right to the top of our list. Have a listen, you will see why.
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Lyle Troxell)
item.itunes:title: Rebooting with Softness
item.itunes:author: Lyle Troxell

item.title: Question Your Perception
item.description:
Ben mentioned...

  • The Toxoplasma of Rage 
  • Scott Alexander
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Ben Jaffe, Lyle Troxell)
item.itunes:title: Question Your Perception
item.itunes:author: Ben Jaffe, Lyle Troxell
item.itunes:summary: Ben Jaffe joins me to shed some light on how much of what we perceive is created by our mind. And the battle between us and the big media companies that are trying to use the bugs in our mind to steal our time.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ben Jaffe joins me to shed some light on how much of what we perceive is created by our mind. And the battle between us and the big media companies that are trying to use the bugs in our mind to steal our time.

item.title: Action is the Antidote
item.description:
Wes Modes's "A Secret History of the American River People" project.

Listener Morgan suggested this clip " Mario Savio | Bodies upon the Gears " that is much like the sentiment from Wes that he attributed to Henry David Thoreau.

item.content:encoded:
Wes Modes's "A Secret History of the American River People" project.

item.itunes:author: Wes Modes, Lyle Troxell
item.itunes:summary: Artists, Activist, Anarchist and Professor Wes Modes chats with me about Teaching, Service Animals, his Shanty Boat Project, Making for Burning Man, Protesting, Police, Purpose, optimism and much more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Artists, Activist, Anarchist and Professor Wes Modes chats with me about Teaching, Service Animals, his Shanty Boat Project, Making for Burning Man, Protesting, Police, Purpose, optimism and much more.

item.title: Connection - Adriana
item.description: Adriana has stayed connected with people through out her life and built both a wonderful support structure and also a sense of belonging. She has also picked up the banjo, so let's go get a theme-song and an interesting conversation.
item.author: lyle@troxell.com (Adriana Troxell Elliot, Lyle Troxell)
